description: The most popular alcoholic beverage worldwide.
fun fact: Beer ABV varies depending on type: “light beers” only have 2-4% ABV while “malt liquors” have 6-8% ABV.

description: The most common sparking wine, usually used for celebration.
fun fact: Champagne's sparkling comes from injecting carbon dioxide or via natural fermentation processes.

description: Wines that are “fortified” with distilled alcohol such as brandy.
fun fact: The most common fortified wine types are: port wine, sherry, madeira, marsala, vermouth.
By US law, hard cider must contain at least 50% apple juice.

description: A blend of water and fermented honey (also referred to as honey wine).
fun fact: Mead ABV varies depending on the maker and ingredients: sack meads have high ABV (up to 20%), while dry meads have lower ABV values, ranging from 8% to 12%.

description: A well-known Japanese drink made from fermented rice.
fun fact: Sake has a mild taste with little acidity, bitterness or astringency. Cooking sake has a lower ABV, more concentrated flavor, and sometimes contains salt.

description: Made by fermentation from grapes, fruits, berries, rice, or honey.
fun fact: The most common standard wine types are: red wine, white wine, rose, dessert wine, and sparkling wine.

description: A spirit made from juniper berries.
fun fact: Most widely bought gin brands are 40% ABV or above, and some (e.g. “small-batch” or “boutique” gins) can be a lot higher.

description: A spirit made from distilled wine.
fun fact: Cognac, a famous type of brandy, has 40% ABV.

description: A spirit made from fermented grain.
fun fact: The most common whiskey types are: scotch, bourbon, Irish and Canadian whiskeys. Whiskey ABV depends on how long the whiskey has aged.

description: A distilled drink made from fermented sugarcane or molasses.
fun fact: Typical rum ABV is 40%. Some rum is “overproof” and has alcohol concentration of at least 57.5% ABV. Most overproof rum exceeds this minimum, usually reaching 75.5% ABV.

description: A type of liquor made from the Mexican agave plant.
fun fact: Tequila can be bottled anywhere from 35%-55% ABV but the US has a minimum of 40% ABV.

description: A liquor usually made from fermented grains and potatoes.
fun fact: Standard vodka ABV in the US is 40%. Vodka has a neutral taste and is odorless and colorless.

description: A spirit made from a variety of leaves and herbs.
fun fact: Absinthe is a very potent drink, although there is no evidence that absinthe is a hallucinogen.

description: A grain-based spirit with a heavy concentration of alcohol.
fun fact: Everclear is the most potent liquor on the market, and the stronger proof is illegal in many US states. The minimum Everclear ABV is 60%, but Everclear can also have 75.5% and 95% ABV.
